quotes: Every expert was once a beginner.
Don’t be afraid to break things — that’s how you learn.
Debugging is just problem-solving with extra steps.
Your code doesn’t have to be perfect, just functional — perfection can come later.
Keep building. The logic will click with time.
You’re not stuck — you’re learning something new.
Read error messages; they’re clues, not criticism.
Write code like your future self has to debug it.
Small wins in coding are still wins.
The best way to learn to code is to keep coding.
